verses.verse: Now Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> perceived<WH3045> that the king<WH4428>'s heart<WH3820> was toward Absalom<WH53>.

And Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> to Tekoah<WH8620>, and fetched<WH3947> there a wise<WH2450> woman<WH802>, and said<WH559> unto her<WH56>, I pray you, feign yourself to be a mourner, and put on<WH3847> now mourning<WH60> apparel<WH899>, and anoint<WH5480> not yourself with oil<WH8081>, but be as a woman<WH802> that had a long<WH7227> time<WH3117> mourned<WH56> for the dead<WH4191>:
And come<WH935> to the king<WH4428>, and speak<WH1696> on this manner<WH1697> unto him<WH3097>. So Joab put<WH7760> the words<WH1697> in her mouth<WH6310>.

And when the woman<WH802> of Tekoah<WH8621> spoke<WH559> to the king<WH4428>, she fell<WH5307> on her face<WH639> to the ground<WH776>, and did bow<WH7812>, and said<WH559>, Help<WH3467>, O king<WH4428>.
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto her<WH559>, What ails you? And she answered, I am indeed<WH61> a widow<WH490> woman<WH802>, and my husband<WH376> is dead<WH4191>.

And your handmaid<WH8198> had two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, and they two<WH8147> argued together<WH5327> in the field<WH7704>, and there was none to part<WH5337> them<WH259>, but the one struck<WH5221> the other<WH259>, and killed him<WH4191>.

And<WH4940>, behold, the whole family is risen<WH6965> against your handmaid<WH8198>, and they said<WH559>, Deliver<WH5414> him that struck<WH5221> his brother<WH251>, that we may kill<WH4191> him<WH5315>, for the life of his brother<WH251> whom he killed<WH2026>; and we will destroy<WH8045> the heir<WH3423> also<WH3518>: and so they shall quench my coal<WH1513> which is left<WH7760>, and shall not leave<WH7604> to my husband<WH376> neither name<WH8034> nor remainder<WH7611> upon<WH6440> the earth<WH127>.
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto the woman<WH802>, Go<WH3212> to your house<WH1004>, and I will give charge concerning you<WH6680>.

And the woman<WH802> of Tekoah<WH8621> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, My lord<WH113>, O king<WH4428>, the iniquity<WH5771> be on me<WH1>, and on my father's house<WH1004>: and the king<WH4428> and his throne<WH3678> be guiltless<WH5355>.
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Whoever says<WH1696> anything unto you<WH935>, bring him to me<WH5060>, and he shall not touch you any more<WH3254>.

Then said<WH559> she<WH4428>, I pray you, let the king remember<WH2142> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, that you would not allow the revengers<WH1350> of blood<WH1818> to destroy<WH7843> any more<WH7235>, lest they destroy<WH8045> my son<WH1121>. And he said<WH559>, As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, there shall not one hair<WH8185> of your son<WH1121> fall<WH5307> to the earth<WH776>.
Then the woman<WH802> said<WH559>, Let your handmaid<WH8198>, I pray you<WH1696>, speak one word<WH1697> unto my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>. And he said<WH559>, Say on<WH1696>.

And the woman<WH802> said<WH559>, Why then have you thought<WH2803> such a thing against the people<WH5971> of God<WH430>? for the king<WH4428> does speak<WH1696> this thing<WH1697> as one which is faulty<WH818>, in that the king<WH4428> does not fetch home again<WH7725> his banished<WH5080>.

For we must needs<WH4191> die<WH4191>, and are as water<WH4325> spilt<WH5064> on the ground<WH776>, which cannot be gathered up again<WH622>; neither does God<WH430> respect<WH5375> any person<WH5315>: yet does he devise<WH2803> means<WH4284>, that his banished<WH5080> be not expelled from him<WH5080>.

Now therefore that I am come<WH935> to speak<WH1696> of this thing<WH1697> unto my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>, it is because the people<WH5971> have made me afraid<WH3372>: and your handmaid<WH8198> said<WH559>, I will now speak<WH1696> unto the king<WH4428>; it may be that the king<WH4428> will perform<WH6213> the request<WH1697> of his handmaid<WH519>.

For the king<WH4428> will hear<WH8085>, to deliver<WH5337> his handmaid<WH519> out of the hand<WH3709> of the man<WH376> that would destroy<WH8045> me and my son<WH1121> together<WH3162> out of the inheritance<WH5159> of God<WH430>.

Then your handmaid<WH8198> said<WH559>, The word<WH1697> of my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> shall now be comfortable<WH4496>: for as an angel<WH4397> of God<WH430>, so is my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> to discern<WH8085> good<WH2896> and bad<WH7451>: therefore the Lord<WH3068> your God will be with you<WH430>.

Then the king<WH4428> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto the woman<WH802>, Hide<WH3582> not from me<WH1697>, I pray you, the thing that I shall ask<WH7592> you<WH802>. And the woman said<WH559>, Let my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> now speak<WH1696>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Is not the hand<WH3027> of Joab<WH3097> with you in all this<WH802>? And the woman answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, As your soul<WH5315> lives<WH2416>, my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>, none<WH376> can<WH786> turn to the right hand<WH3231> or to the left<WH8041> from anything that my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> has spoken<WH1696>: for your servant<WH5650> Joab<WH3097>, he told<WH6680> me<WH7760>, and he put all these words<WH1697> in the mouth<WH6310> of your handmaid<WH8198>:

To<WH5668> turn around<WH5437> the face<WH6440> of this matter<WH1697> has your servant<WH5650> Joab<WH3097> done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>: and my lord<WH113> is wise<WH2450>, according to the wisdom<WH2451> of an angel<WH4397> of God<WH430>, to know<WH3045> all things that are in the earth<WH776>.
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Joab<WH3097>, Behold now<WH6213>, I have done this thing<WH1697>: go<WH3212> therefore<WH7725>, bring the young man<WH5288> Absalom<WH53> again<WH7725>.

And Joab<WH3097> fell<WH5307> to the ground<WH776> on his face<WH6440>, and bowed<WH7812> himself<WH1288>, and thanked the king<WH4428>: and Joab<WH3097> said<WH559>, To day<WH3117> your servant<WH5650> knows<WH3045> that I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>, my lord<WH113>, O king<WH4428>, in that the king<WH4428> has fulfilled<WH6213> the request<WH1697> of his servant<WH5650>.
So Joab<WH3097> arose<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to Geshur<WH1650>, and brought<WH935> Absalom<WH53> to Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Let him turn<WH5437> to his own house<WH1004>, and let him not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440>. So Absalom<WH53> returned<WH5437> to his own house<WH1004>, and saw<WH7200> not the king<WH4428>'s face<WH6440>.

But in all Israel<WH3478> there was none<WH376> to be so much<WH3966> praised<WH1984> as Absalom<WH53> for his beauty<WH3303>: from the sole<WH3709> of his foot<WH7272> even to the crown of his head<WH6936> there was no blemish in him<WH3971>.

And when he cut<WH1548> his head<WH7218>, (for it was at every year<WH3117>'s end<WH7093> that he cut<WH1548> it<WH3513>: because the hair was heavy on him<WH1548>, therefore he cut it<WH8254>:) he weighed the hair<WH8181> of his head<WH7218> at two hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> after the king<WH4428>'s weight<WH68>.

And unto Absalom<WH53> there were born<WH3205> three<WH7969> sons<WH1121>, and one<WH259> daughter<WH1323>, whose name<WH8034> was Tamar<WH8559>: she was a woman<WH802> of a fair<WH3303> favor<WH4758>.
So Absalom<WH53> lived<WH3427> two full<WH3117> years<WH8141> in Jerusalem<WH3389>, and saw<WH7200> not the king<WH4428>'s face<WH6440>.

Therefore Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> for Joab<WH3097>, to have sent<WH7971> him to the king<WH4428>; but he would<WH14> not come<WH935> to him<WH7971>: and when he sent again the second time<WH8145>, he would<WH14> not come<WH935>.

Therefore he said<WH559> unto his servants<WH5650>, See<WH7200>, Joab<WH3097>'s field<WH2513> is near<WH413> my<WH3027>, and he has barley<WH8184> there<WH3212>; go and set<WH3341> it on fire<WH784>. And Absalom<WH53>'s servants<WH5650> set<WH3341> the field<WH2513> on fire<WH784>.
Then Joab<WH3097> arose<WH6965>, and came<WH935> to Absalom<WH53> unto his house<WH1004>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH5650>, Why have your servants set<WH3341> my field<WH2513> on fire<WH784>?

And Absalom<WH53> answered<WH559> Joab<WH3097>, Behold<WH7971>, I sent unto you<WH559>, saying, Come<WH935> here<WH7971>, that I may send you to the king<WH4428>, to say<WH559>, Why am I come<WH935> from Geshur<WH1650>? it would be better<WH2896> for me to have stayed there still<WH7200>: now therefore let me see the king<WH4428>'s face<WH6440>; and if there be<WH3426> any iniquity<WH5771> in me<WH4191>, let him kill me.

So Joab<WH3097> came<WH935> to the king<WH4428>, and told<WH5046> him<WH7121>: and when he had called for Absalom<WH53>, he came<WH935> to the king<WH4428>, and bowed<WH7812> himself on his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>: and the king<WH4428> kissed<WH5401> Absalom<WH53>.
